    {\large January 2026}

\vspace{1em}

\section*{What's New in v5.7.0}

This release includes critical fixes to the YTD Return calculation, improved chart readability, and new tabs for better organization of cash positions and administrative items.

%----------------------------------------------------------------------
\section{YTD Return Calculation Fix}
%----------------------------------------------------------------------

\begin{fixbox}
The YTD Return displayed on the Dashboard now reads from Column H (``Jan 1 ROR'') of the Custom file's total row, instead of a calculated P\&L / Market Value ratio. This fixes an issue where the displayed return was approximately 2x the actual fund return.
\end{fixbox}

\textit{Previous behavior}: YTD Return was calculated as Total P\&L divided by Total Market Value. This calculation was incorrect because the P\&L column shows total gains since each position was opened, not YTD gains.

\textit{New behavior}: YTD Return now reads from Column H of the Custom file's last row (validated by checking Column D = 1.0 for the total row). This is the administrator-provided time-weighted return.

\textbf{Impact}: The Dashboard now shows the correct official YTD return from the source data.

%----------------------------------------------------------------------
\section{Chart Readability Improvements}
%----------------------------------------------------------------------

\subsection*{P\&L Chart Label Positioning}

\begin{improvementbox}
The YTD P\&L: Top Gainers \& Losers chart now positions category labels at the far left of the chart, preventing black text from overlapping with navy blue bars.
\end{improvementbox}

\textit{Previous behavior}: Stock names were positioned adjacent to the bars, causing black text to overlap with navy blue bars when values were small, making labels unreadable.

\textit{New behavior}: Labels are positioned at the far left edge of the chart using \texttt{xlTickLabelPositionLow}, ensuring they never overlap with bars regardless of bar length.

\subsection*{Label Truncation}

Long stock names are now truncated to 20 characters maximum to prevent overflow issues in charts. Names longer than 20 characters are shortened with ``..'' suffix.

%----------------------------------------------------------------------
\section{New Tabs for Better Organization}
%----------------------------------------------------------------------

\subsection*{Currencies Tab}

\begin{newfeaturebox}
A new ``Currencies'' tab has been added to display cash positions separately from stock holdings.
\end{newfeaturebox}

Cash positions in the following currencies are now routed to the dedicated Currencies tab:
\begin{itemize}[nosep]
    \item USD, CAD, JPY, EUR, GBP
    \item AED, MAD, CHF, HKD, SGD
    \item AUD, NZD, CNY, KRW, TWD
    \item INR, BRL, MXN, ZAR
\end{itemize}

\subsection*{Other Tab}

\begin{newfeaturebox}
A new ``Other'' tab has been added to display administrative and expense items separately.
\end{newfeaturebox}

The following types of items are now routed to the dedicated Other tab:
\begin{itemize}[nosep]
    \item Accrued Dividends and Interest
    \item Payables and Receivables
    \item Management and Administration Fees
    \item Tax-related items
    \item Due From/To Affiliates
    \item Prepaid Expenses
    \item Organization Costs
\end{itemize}

%----------------------------------------------------------------------
\section{Other Changes}
%----------------------------------------------------------------------

\begin{itemize}[nosep]
    \item Output filename now includes both report date and processing date: \texttt{Portfolio\_MMDDYYYY\_gen\_MMDDYYYY.xlsx}
    \item Removed Fund Performance Summary section from Stocks tab
    \item Stocks column A expanded for single-line display of names
    \item Top Holdings bar chart shows biggest holdings at top (reversed axis)
    \item Gainers/Losers bar chart shows gainers at top (reversed axis)
    \item Performance chart now shows YTD Return \% instead of portfolio value
    \item Performance chart Y-axis uses 2\% increments
    \item Total Portfolio Value now includes all tabs: Stocks + Options + Currencies + Other
\end{itemize}

%----------------------------------------------------------------------
\section*{Technical Summary}
%----------------------------------------------------------------------

\subsection*{Changes Summary}

\begin{itemize}[nosep]
    \item YTD Return reads from Custom file Column H (``Jan 1 ROR''), last row with data
    \item Validation: Column D must equal 1.0 to confirm total row
    \item Output filename format: \texttt{Portfolio\_[reportDate]\_gen\_[processDate].xlsx}
    \item P\&L chart uses \texttt{xlTickLabelPositionLow} for label positioning
    \item Stock names truncated to 20 characters in chart data
    \item New \texttt{IsCurrency()} function for routing cash positions
    \item New \texttt{IsAdminExpense()} function for routing admin items
    \item New Currencies worksheet created after Options tab
    \item New Other worksheet created after Currencies tab
\end{itemize}

\subsection*{File Structure}

The release includes the following files:

\begin{itemize}[nosep]
    \item \texttt{files/Portfolio Transformer.xlsm} --- Excel workbook with transformation macros
    \item \texttt{files/OutlookMonitor.txt} --- VBA code for Outlook email monitoring
    \item \texttt{files/TransformerMacro.txt} --- Excel VBA macro source code (for reference)
    \item \texttt{docs/SETUP\_GUIDE.pdf} --- Detailed setup and installation instructions
    \item \texttt{docs/RELEASE\_NOTES\_v5.7.0.pdf} --- This document
\end{itemize}

\subsection*{Update Instructions}

\begin{highlightbox}
For existing users: Simply replace the existing \texttt{Portfolio Transformer.xlsm} file in \texttt{C:\textbackslash Mobius Reports\textbackslash} and update the Outlook monitor code. All changes are automatic and require no additional configuration.
\end{highlightbox}

\textbf{Update Steps:}
\begin{enumerate}[nosep]
    \item Replace \texttt{Portfolio Transformer.xlsm} in \texttt{C:\textbackslash Mobius Reports\textbackslash}
    \item In Outlook: Press Alt+F11, open ThisOutlookSession
    \item Paste contents of \texttt{OutlookMonitor.txt} (replacing existing code)
    \item Save and restart Outlook
\end{enumerate}

%----------------------------------------------------------------------

\begin{center}
\begin{tabularx}{\textwidth}{clX}
\toprule
\textbf{Version} & \textbf{Date} & \textbf{Changes} \\
\midrule
5.7.0 & Jan 2026 & YTD Return fix (uses K94); Chart label positioning; New Currencies and Other tabs; Removed Fund Performance Summary \\
5.6.3 & Jan 2026 & Fixed Total Portfolio Value to include cash positions and Options market value \\
5.6.2 & Jan 2026 & Outlook monitor improvements; Excel layout cleanup \\
5.6.1 & Dec 2025 & Performance tracking and charts \\
5.6.0 & Dec 2025 & Column width optimization, text-wrapped headers \\
5.5 & Dec 2025 & Data accuracy fixes, column width adjustments \\
5.4 & Dec 2025 & Dashboard with KPIs and charts \\
5.3 & Dec 2025 & Removed Bloomberg dependency \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabularx}
\end{center}
